[[Image:Amtrak Mark V RoadRailer - tailgate end.jpg|thumb|The tailgate end of an [[Amtrak]] Mark V "RoadRailer" in [[Winslow, Arizona]] in March, 1999. The unit can travel at speeds of up to {{convert|100|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} in either direction.]]

[[Image:Amtrak Mark V RoadRailer - tailgate end.jpg|thumb|{{deletable image-caption|Thursday, 11 August 2011}} The tailgate end of an [[Amtrak]] Mark V "RoadRailer" in [[Winslow, Arizona]] in March, 1999. The unit can travel at speeds of up to {{convert|100|mph|km/h|abbr=on}} in either direction.]]
The advantage of using roadrailers is that due to their construction, the trailers can be pulled directly behind other freight (or even passenger) equipment without the use of trailer [[flatcar]]s.
The advantage of using roadrailers is that due to their construction, the trailers can be pulled directly behind other freight (or even passenger) equipment without the use of trailer [[flatcar]]s.
